## Summary

lookup table created for a global analysis of marine species ranges for https://doi.org/10.1111/gcb.15844 (Roberson, L. A. et al. 2021. “Multinational Coordination Required for Conservation of over 90% of Marine Species.” Global Change Biology, 1–11). 
Neither database has a lookup table to match a IUCN ID to an AM ID (as of 2020)
Due to inconsistencies in taxonomy or spelling of species names, matching on species name misses matches
Not all species with maps in AM have maps in IUCN, and visa versa
Habitat (marine v terrestrial) delineations are subjective (e.g. for species that use both, estuarine or semi aquatic species) so there is no "marine" v "terrestrial" categorization given in IUCN that is consistent. AquaMaps focuses on marine and aquatic 
For this analysis, which focused on marine/coastal species, some subjective decisions were made (e.g. not counting hippopotomous or cane toads as marine)

*Here I also add the iucn and AM species that are unique to one of the databases*

# comments on AM
AM=AquaMaps
Version 0816D

# comments on IUCN
version 2019.2
Pulled all taxonomic groups that are entirely marine (e.g. cetaceans) and excluded groups that have no marine species (e.g. arachnids). For groups with both, used downloaded the larger group and then used a series of filtering steps to focus on marine and aquatic species


```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(here)
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(data.table)
library(pillar)
library(janitor)
library(writexl) # install.packages("writexl")
library(openxlsx) # install.packages("openxlsx")

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

# load species lists to combine
```{r load spp lists}

both <- read_csv(here("_data/species_lists/spp_am_v_iucn_2019_2 copy.csv"))
glimpse(both) # 2568 species
# has class (Sentence) but not kingdom (all marine IUCN species are animals)

am <- read_csv(here("_data/species_lists/am_spp_list.csv"))
glimpse(am) # 24,938
# does not have class or kingdom, or whether the map was reviewed. Don't need to use this one

am.only <- read_csv(here("_data/species_lists/am_only_spp_info.csv"))
glimpse(am.only) # 22,433
# has kingdom (lower) and class (Sentence)
22433 + 2568
#am.only$kingdom <- str_to_upper(am.only$kingdom)
am.only <- am.only %>% rename(kingdom_am="kingdom", phylum_am="phylum", class_am="class")

iucn <- read_csv(here("_data/species_lists/iucn_spp_list_2019_2_marine_cleaned.csv"))
glimpse(iucn) # 9,916
iucn <- iucn %>% rename(redlist_category=sciname) # has kingdom (CAPS) and class (CAPS)
unique(iucn$class)
iucn %>% filter(is.na(class)) # 16, they're NAs in every col
#iucn$class <- str_to_sentence(iucn$class) 
unique(iucn$class) # IUCN has seabirds, AM doesn't
iucn <- iucn%>%
  rename(kingdom_iucn="kingdom", phylum_iucn="phylum", class_iucn="class")

```

# Make full lookup table
including species that are only in one of hte databases
```{r add to lookup}

## remake the "both" dataframe with species that match on the name first round
matches1 <- inner_join(am.only, iucn, by="sciname")
glimpse(matches1) # 4027... turns out these are NOT AM only
matches1
# try to sort out the taxa cols
matches1$class_iucn <- str_to_sentence(matches1$class_iucn) 
matches1 %>% filter(class_am!=class_iucn) # oh right the chonds v elasmos problem
matches1 %>% filter(class_am!=class_iucn) %>% distinct(class_am, class_iucn)
#   class_am       class_iucn    
# 1 Elasmobranchii Chondrichthyes
# 2 Holocephali    Chondrichthyes
# 3 Equisetopsida  Liliopsida    
# 4 Magnoliopsida  Liliopsida  

matches1$kingdom_iucn <- str_to_sentence(matches1$kingdom_iucn) 
matches1 %>% filter(kingdom_am!=kingdom_iucn) # none, good - can remove one of these
matches1 <- matches1 %>% select(-kingdom_am) %>% rename(kingdom=kingdom_iucn)

matches1$phylum_iucn <- str_to_sentence(matches1$phylum_iucn) 
matches1 %>% filter(phylum_am!=phylum_iucn) # none, good - can remove one of these
matches1 <- matches1 %>% select(-phylum_am) %>% rename(phylum=phylum_iucn)

glimpse(matches1)

## clean col names
matches1 <- matches1 %>% rename(am_sid=species_id, sciname_both=sciname)

# from the first "both" file, find species that have different names in the two databases
diffnames <- both %>% filter(sciname!=am_sciname)
diffnames
diffnames.toadd <- diffnames %>% select(c(iucn_sid, class, sciname, am_sid, am_sciname, iucn_id, am_sid_old))
unique(diffnames.toadd$class)
# these look like the AM classes

  rename(iucn_sid_other=iucn_id, redlist_category=sciname, class_am=class) %>%

glimpse(diffnames.toadd)

# add the redlist category frmo iucn

unique(iucn$kingdom_iucn)

diffnames.toadd <- diffnames.toadd %>%

## bind to matches1

glimpse(diffnames.toadd)

matches1$am_sciname <- matches1$sciname_both
matches1 <- matches1 %>% select(-sciname_both)
diffnames.toadd$class_iucn <- diffnames.toadd$class_am
matches1$am_sid_old <- "NA"
matches1$iucn_sid_other <- "NA"
```

# Found a few that have been added to IUCN
(chonds)
doing EPBC analysis
```{r update sharks}

lookup <- read_excel(here("_data/species_lists/lookup_marine_species_iucn_or_aquamaps.xlsx"), sheet=2)
glimpse(lookup) # 28,308
lookup <- lookup %>% mutate(across(where(is.character), ~na_if(., "NA")))
lookup <- lookup %>% mutate(class_iucn=str_to_sentence(class_iucn))
lookup %>% filter(redlist_category!=am_sciname) %>% distinct(redlist_category, am_sciname, class_iucn) %>% View() # good, no chodns
lookup %>% filter(is.na(class_iucn)) %>% distinct(class_am) # elasmos in here
lookup %>% filter(is.na(class_iucn) & is.na(class_am)) # none, good

chonds.assess <- read_csv(here("_data/extra_data/redlist_species_data_CHONDRICHTHYES_2022_2/assessments.csv"))
glimpse(chonds.assess) # 1,234
summary(chonds.assess$yearPublished)
chonds.tax <- read_csv(here("_data/extra_data/redlist_species_data_CHONDRICHTHYES_2022_2/taxonomy.csv"))
glimpse(chonds.tax) #  1,234

chonds.assess <- chonds.assess %>%
  janitor::clean_names(case="snake") %>%
  select(c(internal_taxon_id, scientific_name, redlist_category, year_published))
chonds.tax <- chonds.tax %>%
  janitor::clean_names(case="snake") %>%
  select(c(internal_taxon_id, scientific_name, kingdom_name, phylum_name, class_name))

chonds <- inner_join(chonds.assess, chonds.tax, by=c("internal_taxon_id", "scientific_name"))
glimpse(chonds) # 1,234

chonds %>% filter(year_published >= 2019) # 887

chonds.2022 <- chonds %>% pull(scientific_name)
lookup %>% filter(redlist_category %in% chonds.2022) # 1016 already in here
lookup %>% filter(am_sciname %in% chonds.2022) # 732 match with AM name
lookup %>% filter(am_sciname %in% chonds.2022 & redlist_category=="aquamaps_only") # only 26 were previously AM only and have been added to IUCN

chonds <- chonds %>% 
  rename(kingdom=kingdom_name, phylum=phylum_name, class_iucn=class_name, iucn_sid=internal_taxon_id, iucn_sciname=scientific_name) %>%
  mutate(phylum=str_to_sentence(phylum), class_iucn=str_to_sentence(class_iucn))
1016+887 # 1903
chonds <- chonds %>% mutate(download_date=2023) %>% select(-year_published)

## merge and update
lookup.new <- lookup %>% mutate(download_date=2019)

glimpse(lookup.new)
glimpse(chonds)

chonds %>% filter(iucn_sciname=="Pristis pristis")

lookup.new <- merge(lookup.new, chonds, by =c("iucn_sid", "iucn_sciname", "kingdom", "phylum", "class_iucn"), suffixes = c("_v2019", "_v2022"), all.x = TRUE)
glimpse(lookup.new) # 28,308

# Update the IUCNcolumns with values from new chonds where available
lookup.new$download_date <- ifelse(is.na(lookup.new$download_date_v2022), lookup.new$download_date_v2019, lookup.new$download_date_v2022)
lookup.new$redlist_category <- ifelse(is.na(lookup.new$redlist_category_v2022), lookup.new$redlist_category_v2019, lookup.new$redlist_category_v2022)

# Remove the duplicate columns from the merge
lookup.new <- lookup.new[, !grepl("_v2019", names(lookup.new))]
lookup.new <- lookup.new[, !grepl("_v2022", names(lookup.new))]

# checks
lookup.new %>% filter(!is.na(iucn_sciname)) %>% hablar::find_duplicates(iucn_sciname) # none
lookup.new %>% filter(!is.na(am_sciname)) %>% hablar::find_duplicates(am_sciname)
lookup.new %>% filter(iucn_sciname=="Microphis brachyurus ssp. aculeatus") # I think the separate AM species got dropped 

am.only %>% filter(str_detect(sciname, "Microphis", regex = TRUE))
am.only %>% filter(str_detect(sciname, "(?i)^aculeatus"))
am.only %>% filter(str_detect(sciname, "(?i)^brachyurus"))

## now repeat for species that were previously in AM but not in IUCN
lookup.int <- lookup.new %>% select(c(iucn_sciname, am_sciname)) %>% filter(is.na(iucn_sciname) & !is.na(am_sciname))
glimpse(lookup.int)
newiucnchonds <- inner_join(chonds, lookup.int, by=c("iucn_sciname"="am_sciname"))
glimpse(newiucnchonds) # tjhe 26 new ones
newiucnchonds %>% filter(iucn_sciname=="Pristis pristis") # There is is

newiucnchonds <- newiucnchonds %>% select(-iucn_sciname.y)
newiucnchonds <- newiucnchonds %>% rename(sciname=iucn_sciname)
glimpse(lookup.new)
matched_indices <- match(lookup.new$am_sciname, newiucnchonds$sciname)
# Update "iucn_sid", "iucn_sciname", "redlist_category", "class_iucn", and "download_date" in "lookup.new"
lookup.new$iucn_sid <- ifelse(is.na(lookup.new$iucn_sid), newiucnchonds$iucn_sid[matched_indices], lookup.new$iucn_sid)
lookup.new$iucn_sciname <- ifelse(is.na(lookup.new$iucn_sciname), newiucnchonds$sciname[matched_indices], lookup.new$iucn_sciname)
lookup.new$redlist_category <- ifelse(lookup.new$redlist_category %in% c("aquamaps_only", NA), 
                                      newiucnchonds$redlist_category[matched_indices], 
                                      lookup.new$redlist_category)
lookup.new$class_iucn <- ifelse(is.na(lookup.new$class_iucn), newiucnchonds$class_iucn[matched_indices], lookup.new$class_iucn)
lookup.new$download_date <- ifelse(is.na(lookup.new$download_date), newiucnchonds$download_date[matched_indices], lookup.new$download_date)

glimpse(lookup.new) 
lookup.new %>% filter(iucn_sciname=="Pristis pristis")

## check chond species that are new to IUCN and weren't in AM
sciname <- union(lookup.new$iucn_sciname, lookup.new$am_sciname)
new.chonds <- setdiff(chonds.2022, sciname)
glimpse(new.chonds) # 192 species

to.add <- chonds %>% filter(iucn_sciname %in% new.chonds)
summary(to.add$download_date) # all 2023 downloads, makes sense
names(lookup.new)
names(to.add)
to.add <- to.add %>%
  mutate(am_sciname=NA, am_sid=NA, class_am=NA, am_sid=NA, am_sid_old=NA, iucn_sid_other=NA)
28308 + 192 # should end up with  28500
lookup.new <- bind_rows(lookup.new, to.add)
glimpse(lookup.new) # Rows: 28,500

lookup.new %>% filter(iucn_sciname=="Pristis pristis")

##<><><><<> save update
# load workbook
lookup <- loadWorkbook(here("_data/species_lists/lookup_marine_species_iucn_or_aquamaps.xlsx"))
# Create a new sheet and name it
new_sheet_name <- "lookup with 2022 sharks"
addWorksheet(lookup, sheetName = new_sheet_name)
# Write the data from lookup.new to the new sheet
writeData(lookup, new_sheet_name, lookup.new)
saveWorkbook(lookup, here("_data/species_lists/lookup_marine_species_iucn_or_aquamaps.xlsx"), overwrite = TRUE)
```
